channel.title: Comments on: Playing with PetaPoco
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.description: An interesting thing about PetaPoco is that it really nudges you in the direction of having one and has support for auto-incrementing id's built right in. I may end up doing a more in depth follow-up just on some of the more interesting features it has where you can really tell it's trying to remove the cookie cutter code without changing how you work with the stuff that changes from query to query (like the query :P).
item.content:encoded: An interesting thing about PetaPoco is that it really nudges you in the direction of having one and has support for auto-incrementing id’s built right in. I may end up doing a more in depth follow-up just on some of the more interesting features it has where you can really tell it’s trying to remove the cookie cutter code without changing how you work with the stuff that changes from query to query (like the query :P).

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: That is brave indeed that Chrissie doesn't have a primary key...or he simply doesn't know what a primary key is :-)
item.content:encoded: That is brave indeed that Chrissie doesn’t have a primary key…or he simply doesn’t know what a primary key is ðŸ™‚
